# Ginzberg's Ringer Solution {#sec-general_recipe_ginzbergs_ringers}

## Introduction

-   **Purpose**: Recipe for making ginzberg's ringers solution\
-   **Procedure Type**: recipe
-   **Species**:
    -   Threespine stickleback, (*Gasterosteus aculeatus*)
-   **Author**: Mark Currey
-   **Date Created**: January 1, 2004

## Materials

-   NaCl
-   KCl
-   CaCl2
-   NaHCO3
-   npH2O

::: {.callout-Note title="NOTE"}
All of these reagents should be located in the chemical cabinet.
:::

## Solutions

-   none

## Procedure

For 1000 mls, mix: 1. Mix solids into 750 ml of npH2O - 6.6g NaCl - 0.25g KCl - 0.3g CaCl2 - 0.2g NaHCO3 2. Bring to 1 liter total volume with npH2O. 3. Store at 4Â° C.
